title: The Waiting Game: A Garvey Fields Mystery
features: “If it were easy everyone would do it!” He’s from Brooklyn, he’s got a dirty mouth, he’s always thinking about sex and he can’t let an investigation go once he gets started. He is P.I Garvey Fields. Garvey Fields has taken a good job in a hotel as the chief of security because money is low and he’s got a crush on the sexy receptionist. However what starts out as an unruly guest keep the guests up and trying to entice a young groupie into some freaky sex game; soon turns into the murder of a man blackmailed for something he did years earlier. And there's a mysterious woman in the penthouse suite with some dangerous baggage who wants to make Garvey her personal plaything. Before long he’s looking for work elsewhere and trying to figure out who killed who, were, why and when. Added to the mix is an up and coming singer who is being manipulated by a record label boss that has many fingers in many pies. Whether you want with dialogue, sexy characters or just a good old racy mystery romp, this book is a fast paced enjoyable read.
description: "If it were easy everyone would do it!" He's from Brooklyn, he's got a dirty mouth, he's always thinking about sex and he can't let an investigation go once he gets started. He is P.I Garvey Fields. Garvey Fields has taken a good job in a hotel as the chief of security because money is low. However what starts out as an unruly guest turns into a murder mystery. And there's a mysterious woman in the penthouse suite with some dangerous baggage. Join Garvey as he leaves state to follow leads, finds himself in compromising, dodging bullets, the cops and falling bodies. And of course there's the women that's can't help falling for him.

RA Chandler is a mystery novelist that has created the African American private detective Garvey Fields. He has written and published short stories in the past but this is his first series of books at novel length. RA has a degree in English Literature, been a teacher for a short time and wants to write and publish books until his last breath. He loves to read Walter Mosley, Robert B. Parker, Eric Jerome Dickey, Wallace Thurman and is still looking for books to love. You can find out more about him and his latest releases at www.rachandler.com.
